questions.question: The following image shows
questions.explanation: most severe form of NTD, characterized by a continuous open defect extending from the skull to the spine. The condition is uniformly fatal . It presents as a combination of: Anencephaly : Absence of the brain and cranial vault, with exposed neural tissue lacking skin coverage. Rachischisis : A contiguous bony defect of the cervical spine, with exposed neural tissue due to the absence of meninges. Spina Bifida (Option C) : Types of Spina Bifida Description Spina Bifida Occulta Spine is abnormal, but the spinal cord is unaffected. Overlying skin is usually normal. May have a small dimple, tuft of hair, or sinus over the skin indicating the defect. Meningocele (Option B) Protrusion of a sac of meninges through the vertebral defect. Contains only clear fluid , no neural components . Transillumination is positive . Myelomeningocele (Option D) Sac protrudes through the defect and contains neural components herniating from the spinal cord.
